example.eg: Julie declared that she was taking the afternoon off.
example.egtrans: 朱莉声明她下午要休息。

example.eg: John declared three cases of champagne when he arrived at the port.
example.egtrans: 来到机场后，约翰申报了三箱香槟。

example.eg: Lisa declared all her income for the year.
example.egtrans: 丽萨为今年自己的所有收入报了税。

example.eg: The judge declared Ben the winner.
The jury declared the defendant guilty.
I hereby declare myself to be a candidate in the forthcoming elections.
example.egtrans: 我在此宣布自己将以候选人的身份参与即将举办的选举。

example.eg: He declared himself to be the long-lost son of the deceased, returned to claim his inheritance.
example.egtrans: 他声称自己是死者失散已久的儿子，回来继承遗产。

example.eg: The minister declared himself to be against the introduction of the euro to Britain.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 公开表明赞成, 公开表明反对

example.eg: Bill has declared for president for the forthcoming election.
The government has declared a state of emergency.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 正式宣布, 正式宣告

example.eg: The presence of company representatives at the meeting declares their willingness to negotiate.
The politician declared herself in favour of curbs on immigration.
Their business relationship ended when the judge declared their contract null and void.

dsense.name: declare war on [sb/sth], declare war against [sb/sth]

example.eg: France declared war on Prussia on July 19, 1870.  On July 28th 1914 Austria-Hungary declared war against Serbia.
example.egtrans: 法国在1870年7月19日向普鲁士王国宣战。1914年7月28日，奥匈帝国向塞尔维亚宣战。

example.eg: President Richard Nixon declared war on drugs in 1971.
example.egtrans: 1971年，理查德·尼克松总统向毒品宣战。
